intro: Psychotria chasalioides, commonly known as the Chasalioides Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and research settings.
